title: How to Bake a Chilli Chocolate Sponge Cake

steps.headline: Heat an oven to 160°C/325ºF/Gas 3 (Reduce by 20°C if using a fan oven)
Grease a cake tin.
steps.description: Use 20cm (8 inches) square, or a spring-form pan.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate.
steps.description:
This can be done using one of the three following ways:
Break the chocolate into as small pieces as possible and place in a small bowl. Boil a small pan of water, then place the bowl of chocolate within. Do not let the water overflow into the chocolate, and stir until completely melted. Put the broken chocolate into a shallow oven-proof dish and heat in an oven at 110°C/225ºF/Gas 1 till completely melted. Only use this method if necessary. Place the broken Chocolate in a microwaveable dish and microwave on full heat for 1-2 minutes, stirring often to let it heat thoroughly.

steps.headline: Leave to cool while proceeding with the instructions.
Combine butter/margarine and sugar in a large bowl using an electric/classic whisk.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, take care not to let the mixture separate.
steps.description: If it does separate, add a bit of flour.

steps.headline: Add the cooled chocolate to the mixture and mix in.
Add the remaining flour to the mixture and stir till smooth.
If you are using fresh chili/es finely chop them, and either add now or crush/blend them to a paste, try a garlic crusher.
steps.description: Use gloves to avoid touching the chili.

steps.headline: Add the chili paste to the mixture now.
steps.description: Add slowly, checking it does not too badly overpower the mixture. Stir till smooth.

steps.headline: Pour the cake mixture into the greased cake tin.
Bake for just under 1 hour or till fully cooked.
steps.description: Check by poking a knife or stick in, and if clean it is cooked. Do not let it burn, so check occasionally. It should be risen and have a slight crust.

steps.headline: Let it cool for 10 minutes, before taking out of the tin.
steps.description: Then leave to cool for another 10 minutes on a wire rack.

steps.headline: The cake could be eaten plain, or if you want to ice it, proceed with the instructions, or choose your own icing choice.
Melt the chocolate as before, and mix together with the cream, and then cool until thickened.
Cut the cake into two layers, ice, then put back together and ice all over.

text:
Cake Heat an oven to 160°C/325ºF/Gas 3 (Reduce by 20°C if using a fan oven)  Grease a cake tin. Use 20cm (8 inches) square, or a spring-form pan. Melt the chocolate. This can be done using one of the three following ways:
Break the chocolate into as small pieces as possible and place in a small bowl. Boil a small pan of water, then place the bowl of chocolate within. Do not let the water overflow into the chocolate, and stir until completely melted. Put the broken chocolate into a shallow oven-proof dish and heat in an oven at 110°C/225ºF/Gas 1 till completely melted. Only use this method if necessary. Place the broken Chocolate in a microwaveable dish and microwave on full heat for 1-2 minutes, stirring often to let it heat thoroughly. Leave to cool while proceeding with the instructions.  Combine butter/margarine and sugar in a large bowl using an electric/classic whisk. Whisk till light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, take care not to let the mixture separate. If it does separate, add a bit of flour. Add the cooled chocolate to the mixture and mix in.  Add the remaining flour to the mixture and stir till smooth.  If you are using fresh chili/es finely chop them, and either add now or crush/blend them to a paste, try a garlic crusher. Use gloves to avoid touching the chili. Add the chili paste to the mixture now. Add slowly, checking it does not too badly overpower the mixture. Stir till smooth. Pour the cake mixture into the greased cake tin.  Bake for just under 1 hour or till fully cooked. Check by poking a knife or stick in, and if clean it is cooked. Do not let it burn, so check occasionally. It should be risen and have a slight crust. Take out the cake  Let it cool for 10 minutes, before taking out of the tin. Then leave to cool for another 10 minutes on a wire rack. The cake could be eaten plain, or if you want to ice it, proceed with the instructions, or choose your own icing choice.  Icing Melt the chocolate as before, and mix together with the cream, and then cool until thickened.  Cut the cake into two layers, ice, then put back together and ice all over.  Garnish as desired.
